availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert M. Ewing (Scott County, Kentucky, soldier and physician)

body.p: Scott County, Kentucky, soldier, physician, and farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Margaret H. Gano Ewing in Scott County, Kentucky, on June 4, 1816. Served in Colonel Scott's Regiment of the Kentucky Militia as a surgeon from August 15, 1812, to February 14, 1813. Served in Colonel Johnston's Regiment of the Kentucky Militia as a surgeon from May 20, 1813, to November 19, 1813. Resident of Scott County, Kentucky, in 1820. Owned two enslaved persons in Scott County in 1820. Resident of Scott County in 1830. Owned three enslaved persons in Scott County in 1830. Resident of Scott County in 1840. Owned eleven enslaved persons in Scott County in 1840. Physician in Scott County in 1850. Owned twelve enslaved persons in Scott County in 1850. Physician and farmer in Scott County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Scott County in 1860.
